speaker: BEVIS
text: Come, and get thee a sword, though made of a

speaker: BEVIS
text: lath. They have been up these two days.

speaker: HOLLAND
text: They have the more need to sleep now, then.

speaker: BEVIS
text: I tell thee, Jack Cade the clothier means to dress

speaker: BEVIS
text: the commonwealth, and turn it, and set a new nap

speaker: BEVIS
text: upon it.

speaker: HOLLAND
text: So he had need, for ’tis threadbare. Well, I

speaker: HOLLAND
text: say, it was never merry world in England since

speaker: HOLLAND
text: gentlemen came up.

speaker: BEVIS
text: O miserable age! Virtue is not regarded in

speaker: BEVIS
text: handicraftsmen.

speaker: HOLLAND
text: The nobility think scorn to go in leather

speaker: HOLLAND
text: aprons.

speaker: BEVIS
text: Nay, more, the King’s Council are no good

speaker: BEVIS
text: workmen.

speaker: HOLLAND
text: True, and yet it is said “Labor in thy vocation,”

speaker: HOLLAND
text: which is as much to say as “Let the magistrates

speaker: HOLLAND
text: be laboring men.” And therefore should we

speaker: HOLLAND
text: be magistrates.

speaker: BEVIS
text: Thou hast hit it, for there’s no better sign of a

speaker: BEVIS
text: brave mind than a hard hand.

speaker: HOLLAND
text: I see them, I see them! There’s Best’s son, the

speaker: HOLLAND
text: tanner of Wingham—

speaker: BEVIS
text: He shall have the skins of our enemies to make

speaker: BEVIS
text: dog’s leather of.

speaker: HOLLAND
text: And Dick the butcher—

speaker: BEVIS
text: Then is sin struck down like an ox, and iniquity’s

speaker: BEVIS
text: throat cut like a calf.

speaker: HOLLAND
text: And Smith the weaver.

speaker: BEVIS
text: Argo, their thread of life is spun.

speaker: HOLLAND
text: Come, come, let’s fall in with them.

speaker: CADE
text: We, John Cade, so termed of our supposed

speaker: CADE
text: father—

speaker: DICK
text: Or rather of stealing a cade of herrings.

speaker: CADE
text: For our enemies shall fall before us, inspired

speaker: CADE
text: with the spirit of putting down kings and princes—

speaker: CADE
text: command silence.

speaker: DICK
text: Silence!

speaker: CADE
text: My father was a Mortimer—

speaker: DICK
text: He was an honest man and a good

speaker: DICK
text: bricklayer.

speaker: CADE
text: My mother a Plantagenet—

speaker: DICK
text: I knew her well; she was a midwife.

speaker: CADE
text: My wife descended of the Lacys.

speaker: DICK
text: She was indeed a peddler’s daughter, and

speaker: DICK
text: sold many laces.

speaker: SMITH
text: But now of late, not able to travel with

speaker: SMITH
text: her furred pack, she washes bucks here at home.

speaker: CADE
text: Therefore am I of an honorable house.

speaker: DICK
text: Ay, by my faith, the field is honorable;

speaker: DICK
text: and there was he born, under a hedge, for his

speaker: DICK
text: father had never a house but the cage.

speaker: CADE
text: Valiant I am—

speaker: SMITH
text: He must needs, for beggary is valiant.

speaker: CADE
text: I am able to endure much—

speaker: DICK
text: No question of that; for I have seen him

speaker: DICK
text: whipped three market-days together.

speaker: CADE
text: I fear neither sword nor fire.

speaker: SMITH
text: He need not fear the sword, for his coat

speaker: SMITH
text: is of proof.

speaker: DICK
text: But methinks he should stand in fear of

speaker: DICK
text: fire, being burnt i’ th’ hand for stealing of sheep.

speaker: CADE
text: Be brave, then, for your captain is brave and

speaker: CADE
text: vows reformation. There shall be in England seven

speaker: CADE
text: halfpenny loaves sold for a penny. The three-hooped

speaker: CADE
text: pot shall have ten hoops, and I will make it

speaker: CADE
text: felony to drink small beer. All the realm shall be in

speaker: CADE
text: common, and in Cheapside shall my palfrey go to

speaker: CADE
text: grass. And when I am king, as king I will be—

speaker: ALL
text: God save your Majesty!

speaker: CADE
text: I thank you, good people.—There shall be no

speaker: CADE
text: money; all shall eat and drink on my score; and I

speaker: CADE
text: will apparel them all in one livery, that they may

speaker: CADE
text: agree like brothers and worship me their lord.

speaker: DICK
text: The first thing we do, let’s kill all the lawyers.

speaker: CADE
text: Nay, that I mean to do. Is not this a lamentable

speaker: CADE
text: thing, that of the skin of an innocent lamb should

speaker: CADE
text: be made parchment? That parchment, being scribbled

speaker: CADE
text: o’er, should undo a man? Some say the bee

speaker: CADE
text: stings, but I say, ’tis the beeswax; for I did but seal

speaker: CADE
text: once to a thing, and I was never mine own man

speaker: CADE
text: since. How now? Who’s there?

speaker: SMITH
text: The clerk of Chartham. He can write and read

speaker: SMITH
text: and cast account.

speaker: CADE
text: O, monstrous!

speaker: SMITH
text: We took him setting of boys’ copies.

speaker: CADE
text: Here’s a villain!

speaker: SMITH
text: H’as a book in his pocket with red letters in ’t.

speaker: CADE
text: Nay, then, he is a conjurer.

speaker: DICK
text: Nay, he can make obligations and write court

speaker: DICK
text: hand.

speaker: CADE
text: I am sorry for ’t. The man is a proper man, of

speaker: CADE
text: mine honor. Unless I find him guilty, he shall not

speaker: CADE
text: die.—Come hither, sirrah; I must examine thee.

speaker: CADE
text: What is thy name?

speaker: CLERK
text: Emmanuel.

speaker: DICK
text: They use to write it on the top of letters.—’Twill

speaker: DICK
text: go hard with you.

speaker: CADE
text: Let me alone.—Dost thou use to write thy

speaker: CADE
text: name? Or hast thou a mark to thyself, like an

speaker: CADE
text: honest, plain-dealing man?

speaker: CLERK
text: Sir, I thank God, I have been so well brought

speaker: CLERK
text: up that I can write my name.

speaker: ALL
text: He hath confessed. Away with him! He’s a villain

speaker: ALL
text: and a traitor.

speaker: CADE
text: Away with him, I say! Hang him with his pen

speaker: CADE
text: and inkhorn about his neck.

speaker: MICHAEL
text: Where’s our general?

speaker: CADE
text: Here I am, thou particular fellow.

speaker: MICHAEL
text: Fly, fly, fly! Sir Humphrey Stafford and his

speaker: MICHAEL
text: brother are hard by, with the King’s forces.

speaker: CADE
text: Stand, villain, stand, or I’ll fell thee down. He

speaker: CADE
text: shall be encountered with a man as good as himself.

speaker: CADE
text: He is but a knight, is he?

speaker: MICHAEL
text: No.

speaker: CADE
text: To equal him I will make myself a knight

speaker: CADE
text:
presently.
                 
                He
                 
                kneels
                .
               Rise up Sir John Mortimer.

speaker: CADE
text:
He
                 
                rises
                .
               Now have at him!

speaker: STAFFORD
text:
Rebellious
               
              hinds
              ,
               
              the
               
              filth
               
              and
               
              scum
               
              of
               
              Kent
              ,

speaker: STAFFORD
text:
Marked
               
              for
               
              the
               
              gallows
              ,
               
              lay
               
              your
               
              weapons
               
              down
              !

speaker: STAFFORD
text:
Home
               
              to
               
              your
               
              cottages
              ;
               
              forsake
               
              this
               
              groom
              .

speaker: STAFFORD
text:
The
               
              King
               
              is
               
              merciful
              ,
               
              if
               
              you
               
              revolt
              .

speaker: BROTHER
text:
But
               
              angry
              ,
               
              wrathful
              ,
               
              and
               
              inclined
               
              to
               
              blood
              ,

speaker: BROTHER
text:
If
               
              you
               
              go
               
              forward
              .
               
              Therefore
               
              yield
              ,
               
              or
               
              die
              .

speaker: CADE
text:
As
               
              for
               
              these
               
              silken-coated
               
              slaves
              ,
               
              I
               
              pass
               
              not
              .

speaker: CADE
text:
It
               
              is
               
              to
               
              you
              ,
               
              good
               
              people
              ,
               
              that
               
              I
               
              speak
              ,

speaker: CADE
text:
Over
               
              whom
              ,
               
              in
               
              time
               
              to
               
              come
              ,
               
              I
               
              hope
               
              to
               
              reign
              ,

speaker: CADE
text:
For
               
              I
               
              am
               
              rightful
               
              heir
               
              unto
               
              the
               
              crown
              .

speaker: STAFFORD
text:
Villain
              ,
               
              thy
               
              father
               
              was
               
              a
               
              plasterer
              ,

speaker: STAFFORD
text:
And
               
              thou
               
              thyself
               
              a
               
              shearman
              ,
               
              art
               
              thou
               
              not
              ?

speaker: CADE
text:
And
               
              Adam
               
              was
               
              a
               
              gardener
              .

speaker: BROTHER
text:
And
               
              what
               
              of
               
              that
              ?

speaker: CADE
text:
Marry
              ,
               
              this
              :
               
              Edmund
               
              Mortimer
              ,
               
              Earl
               
              of
               
              March
              ,

speaker: CADE
text:
Married
               
              the
               
              Duke
               
              of
               
              Clarence’
               
              daughter
              ,
               
              did
               
              he
               
              not
              ?

speaker: STAFFORD
text:
Ay
              ,
               
              sir
              .

speaker: CADE
text:
By
               
              her
               
              he
               
              had
               
              two
               
              children
               
              at
               
              one
               
              birth
              .

speaker: BROTHER
text:
That’s
               
              false
              .

speaker: CADE
text:
Ay
              ,
               
              there’s
               
              the
               
              question
              .
               
              But
               
              I
               
              say
               
              ’tis
               
              true
              .

speaker: CADE
text:
The
               
              elder
               
              of
               
              them
              ,
               
              being
               
              put
               
              to
               
              nurse
              ,

speaker: CADE
text:
Was
               
              by
               
              a
               
              beggar-woman
               
              stol’n
               
              away
              ,

speaker: CADE
text:
And
              ,
               
              ignorant
               
              of
               
              his
               
              birth
               
              and
               
              parentage
              ,

speaker: CADE
text:
Became
               
              a
               
              bricklayer
               
              when
               
              he
               
              came
               
              to
               
              age
              .

speaker: CADE
text:
His
               
              son
               
              am
               
              I
              .
               
              Deny
               
              it
               
              if
               
              you
               
              can
              .

speaker: DICK
text:
Nay
              ,
               
              ’tis
               
              too
               
              true
              .
               
              Therefore
               
              he
               
              shall
               
              be
               
              king
              .

speaker: SMITH
text: Sir, he made a chimney in my father’s house,

speaker: SMITH
text: and the bricks are alive at this day to testify it.

speaker: SMITH
text: Therefore deny it not.

speaker: STAFFORD
text:
And
               
              will
               
              you
               
              credit
               
              this
               
              base
               
              drudge’s
               
              words
              ,

speaker: STAFFORD
text:
That
               
              speaks
               
              he
               
              knows
               
              not
               
              what
              ?

speaker: ALL
text:
Ay
              ,
               
              marry
              ,
               
              will
               
              we
              .
               
              Therefore
               
              get
               
              you
               
              gone
              .

speaker: BROTHER
text:
Jack
               
              Cade
              ,
               
              the
               
              Duke
               
              of
               
              York
               
              hath
               
              taught
               
              you
               
              this
              .

speaker: CADE
CADE
text: sirrah. Tell the King from me that, for his father’s

speaker: CADE
text: sake, Henry the Fifth, in whose time boys went to

speaker: CADE
text: span-counter for French crowns, I am content he

speaker: CADE
text: shall reign, but I’ll be Protector over him.

speaker: DICK
text: And, furthermore, we’ll have the Lord Saye’s

speaker: DICK
text: head for selling the dukedom of Maine.

speaker: CADE
text: And good reason: for thereby is England mained

speaker: CADE
text: and fain to go with a staff, but that my puissance

speaker: CADE
text: holds it up. Fellow kings, I tell you that that Lord

speaker: CADE
text: Saye hath gelded the commonwealth and made it

speaker: CADE
text: an eunuch; and, more than that, he can speak

speaker: CADE
text: French, and therefore he is a traitor.

speaker: STAFFORD
text:
O
              ,
               
              gross
               
              and
               
              miserable
               
              ignorance
              !

speaker: CADE
text: Nay, answer if you can. The Frenchmen are our

speaker: CADE
text: enemies. Go to, then, I ask but this: can he that

speaker: CADE
text: speaks with the tongue of an enemy be a good

speaker: CADE
text: counselor, or no?

speaker: ALL
text:
No
              ,
               
              no
              ,
               
              and
               
              therefore
               
              we’ll
               
              have
               
              his
               
              head
              !

speaker: BROTHER
text:
Well
              ,
               
              seeing
               
              gentle
               
              words
               
              will
               
              not
               
              prevail
              ,

speaker: BROTHER
text:
Assail
               
              them
               
              with
               
              the
               
              army
               
              of
               
              the
               
              King
              .

speaker: STAFFORD
text:
Herald
              ,
               
              away
              ,
               
              and
               
              throughout
               
              every
               
              town

speaker: STAFFORD
text:
Proclaim
               
              them
               
              traitors
               
              that
               
              are
               
              up
               
              with
               
              Cade
              ,

speaker: STAFFORD
text:
That
               
              those
               
              which
               
              fly
               
              before
               
              the
               
              battle
               
              ends

speaker: STAFFORD
text:
May
              ,
               
              even
               
              in
               
              their
               
              wives’
               
              and
               
              children’s
               
              sight

speaker: STAFFORD
text:
Be
               
              hanged
               
              up
               
              for
               
              example
               
              at
               
              their
               
              doors
              .
              —

speaker: STAFFORD
text:
And
               
              you
               
              that
               
              be
               
              the
               
              King’s
               
              friends
              ,
               
              follow
               
              me
              .

speaker: CADE
text:
And
               
              you
               
              that

              the
               
              Commons
              ,

              .

speaker: CADE
text:
Now
               
              show
               
              yourselves
               
              men
              .
               
              ’Tis
               
              for
               
              liberty
              !

speaker: CADE
text:
We
               
              will
               
              not
               
              leave
               
              one
               
              lord
              ,
               
              one
               
              gentleman
              ;

speaker: CADE
text:
Spare
               
              none
               
              but
               
              such
               
              as
               
              go
               
              in

              shoon
              ,

speaker: CADE
text:
For
               
              they

              ,

speaker: CADE

As

              ,

              that
               
              they

              ,

              .

speaker: DICK
text: They are all in order and march toward us.

speaker: CADE
text: But then are we in order when we are most out

speaker: CADE
text: of order. Come, march forward.
